title: Microsoft rebrands Bing as Copilot: Conversational AI-powered search engine
originSummary: Microsoft has rebranded Bing as Copilot, a conversational AI-powered search engine that offers answers, generates text and images.
Copilot can be accessed through Copilot.Microsoft.com with a Microsoft or Entra account, and works on Windows and MacOS using Microsoft Edge or Chrome browsers.

Utilizing GPT-4, Copilot gathers information from the web, primarily Bing, and provides responses in a conversational format, allowing users to ask questions and request AI-generated images. However, users should exercise caution as AI chatbots can sometimes provide misleading or nonsensical information. Copilot is free to use and does not have a waitlist for access.

title: OpenAI Unveils GPTs, Enabling No-Code Custom ChatGPT Models
originSummary: OpenAI has introduced GPTs, which are customized versions of ChatGPT designed for specific tasks, enabling developers to create specialized AI models.
GPTs allow for the integration of external knowledge, instructions, and skills, and can be shared and monetized through the upcoming ChatGPT Store.

These advancements aim to make it easier for users to customize ChatGPT for tasks like teaching math or creating stickers, without the need for coding skills. OpenAI also plans to enhance ChatGPT's capabilities through Actions, which are built on top of plugins.

title: OpenAI's ChatGPT Revolutionizes Chatbot Creation and Monetization
originSummary: OpenAI has launched ChatGPTs, enabling users to create chatbots without coding skills, as part of their mission to democratize AI and empower creators.
Users can define their chatbot's purpose, train it, customize its behavior, and improve it through a user-friendly dashboard.

Creators can monetize their ChatGPTs by integrating them into platforms and charging users based on usage, potentially impacting content creators by boosting user engagement and creating new income streams.

title: AI Prototype Turns Drawings into Working Software: Tldraw's 'Make it Real' Wows Devs
originSummary: Collaborative whiteboard app maker, tldraw, has introduced "Make it Real," a prototype feature that employs AI and OpenAI's GPT-4V API to transform user drawings into working software.
The feature converts vector drawings into Tailwind CSS and JavaScript code, enabling users to create functional sliders, game interfaces, clocks, and more.

While tldraw is an open-source tool, testing the prototype online requires an API key from OpenAI. This innovative functionality highlights the exciting possibilities for software development and interface design in the future.

title: OpenAI's Visit GPT: A Game-Changing Threat to AI Market
originSummary: OpenAI has introduced their latest model, GPT-4 "Super," which offers enhanced performance and increased developer control.
The major announcement, however, is the release of Visit GPT, which has garnered less attention but poses a significant challenge to the AI market and startup ecosystem.
OpenAI was surprised by the rapid adoption of Visit GPT, with 100 million new users joining in just two months, demonstrating its massive reach and potential impact.

title: Dodgers re-sign RHP Ricky Vanasco for one-year deal
originSummary: The Los Angeles Dodgers have re-signed right-handed pitcher Ricky Vanasco to a one-year deal and added him to their 40-man roster.
Vanasco was acquired by the Dodgers through a trade with the Texas Rangers in 2023.
Vanasco has yet to play in the Major Leagues but has recorded a 3.46 ERA with 279 strikeouts over five Minor League seasons.

title: The Transformative Power of Generative AI in Banking
originSummary: Generative AI has the potential to revolutionize the banking industry by offering personalized customer experiences, streamlining operations, and improving security.
It can be utilized in various ways, including powering chatbots, optimizing portfolio management, automating compliance processes, and detecting fraud.

Concerns about compliance and privacy need to be addressed, with banks ensuring they comply with regulations, protect customer data, maintain transparency, and mitigate risks associated with generative AI.

title: Microsoft Rebrands Bing Chat as Copilot to Challenge ChatGPT in AI Push
originSummary: Microsoft has renamed its AI chatbot, Bing Chat, to Copilot to better compete with ChatGPT.
Copilot is positioned as the free version of the chatbot, with a premium version available for Microsoft 365 users.
The rebranding suggests a strategic pivot in Microsoft's AI search efforts, as they aim to challenge Google's dominance in the market.

title: OpenAI Explores Bringing AI Chatbot ChatGPT to Classrooms
originSummary: OpenAI, a start-up supported by Microsoft, is looking to introduce its ChatGPT AI chatbot into classrooms.
ChatGPT is capable of generating human-like content and has been used for tasks like homework help.

OpenAI plans to create a team to investigate the educational applications of ChatGPT and has already partnered with education organizations. Teachers see potential benefits for personalized learning and curriculum support, but there are concerns about privacy when implementing the chatbot widely in schools.
